name: Research and Records
section_name: Get started with your Caribbean research.

choices.name: Learn about resources for doing research in the Caribbean.

content.text:
1. Get started with Caribbean research.

    ☆ Getting Started with Caribbean Genealogy—91:35 - 2019


    ☆ RT—Researching Female Ancestors of the Caribbean—28:59 - 2021



  2. Learn how to use FamilySearch for adding Caribbean ancestors.

    ☆ Caribbean Genealogy Part 2 - How to build your Family Tree—7:59 - 2020



  3. Learn about early emigration to the American Colonies and West Indies.

    ☆ National Archives: American and West Indian Colonies

  4. Learn about research methodologies in the Caribbean.

    ☆ Caribbean Research Methodologies Conference—9:07 - 2016



  5. Learn how to find Virgin Islands family roots in Cuba.

    ☆ Finding Virgin Islands Family Roots in Cuba—53:34



  6. Learn more about Caribbean genealogy research on the ☆Caribbean Family History Group site.
  7. Check out these websites for Caribbean research.

    ☆ WDY—The Best Websites for Tracing Caribbean Ancestors

African American
  1. Learn about African American ancestry in the Caribbean.

    ☆ Researching Your African American ancestry in the Caribbean - 2016
    ☆ RT—Tracing Afro-Caribbean Ancestors: Key Strategies and Methodologies—5:54 - 2021



  2. Get started with African American research for the Caribbean in this video.

    ☆ FMP—African Caribbean Genealogy—2:48 - 2021



  3. Learn about Afro-Caribbean immigration in this article.

    ☆ AR—Ancestors from the West Indies - 2013

  4. Learn how to trace slave roots in the Caribbean.

    ☆ LT—3 Resources for Afro-Caribbean Genealogy: Researching Enslaved Roots
    ☆ RT—Caribbean Slave Registers—19:19 - 2021


  5. Learn more about researching African-Caribbean family history.

    ☆ Researching African-Caribbean Family History - 2017

QUIKLinks

1. Explore the Cuba GenWeb site for resources for Cuban research.
  2. Learn about researching historical Caribbean newspapers in this tutorial from The Ancestor Hunt.

    ☆ Historical Free Caribbean Newspapers Online - 2022

  3. Find links to ☆Caribbean newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  4. Explore resources on the ☆Caribbean Genealogy Library site.
  5. Learn how to find vital records for the ☆U.S. Virgin Islands.
  6. Explore the ☆Genealogy and History of the Caribbean site for resources on the French West Indies.
  7. Explore the ☆Danish West Indies site for resources on the Danish West Indies.
  8. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books about the Caribbean that can be checked out or researched for you by others
  9. Explore Caribbean culture on the ☆Traditions of the Ancestors site (requires a free account)

name: Maps and Atlases
section_name: Explore Caribbean historical atlases and maps.

choices.name: Explore atlases for countries in the Caribbean.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆Atlas of Bahamas on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Explore the ☆Atlas of Barbados on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Explore the ☆Atlas of Cuba on the Wikipedia site.
  4. Explore the ☆Atlas of Haiti on the Wikipedia site.
  5. Explore the ☆Atlas of Trinidad and Tobago on the Wikipedia site.

choices.name: Explore old maps for countries in the Caribbean.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Barbados on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Cuba on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Haiti on the Wikipedia site.
  4. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Trinidad and Tobago on the Wikipedia site.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Caribbean research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Caribbean Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Caribbean Genealogy Facebook page for FamilySearch.
  3. Visit the ☆Caribbean Genealogy Library Family Research Inquiries Facebook page.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks to quickly search the most common record collections for Caribbean countries (outside of Jamaica).

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  2. Explore the Caribbean page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

choices.name: Explore additional record collections and resources.

content.text:
1. In FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast, explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.
  2. Explore the Cuba GenWeb site for resources for Cuban research.
  3. Learn about Jewish settlement in the Caribbean.

    ☆ RT—Tracing Afro-Caribbean Ancestors: Key Strategies and Methodologies—19:50

1. Explore the Caribbean page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.
